properties.title: Cyclone Ditwah
properties.description: Cyclone Ditwah: Hit Sri Lanka at the end of November/early December, closing the Port of Colombo for 72 hours and leaving a 2-3 day berthing queue.

properties.title: Severe winter weather in the U.S. Midwest and other regions tightened trucking
properties.description: Severe winter weather in the U.S. Midwest and other regions tightened trucking capacity during the December peak. These storms disrupted freight flows, cancelled flights and pushed up regional shipping rates during typical holiday surges.

properties.description: Rutigliano Logistics Center, Italy: On December 27, 2025, a large fire devastated a warehouse in the Rutigliano industrial area of Bari. properties.title: Central Java Food Facility, Indonesia
properties.description: Central Java Food Facility, Indonesia: A major blaze broke out on December 1, 2025, at a food manufacturing facility. The fire caused significant damage to warehouses, impacting the local food supply chain.

properties.title: ONE Henry Hudson (Port of Los Angeles)
properties.description: ONE Henry Hudson (Port of Los Angeles): Following a fire that originally broke out on November 21, the discharge of damaged containers from the vessel began in December. properties.title: Aerosucre Boeing 727-200 (Colombia)
properties.description: Aerosucre Boeing 727-200 (Colombia): On December 12, 2025, a Boeing 727 freighter operated by Aerosucre suffered a landing gear collapse upon touchdown at Ernesto Cortissoz International Airport in Barranquilla. The incident resulted in significant damage to the aircraft and caused the temporary closure of the airport, though no injuries were reported among the crew.

properties.title: MD-11 Fleet Grounding
properties.description: MD-11 Fleet Grounding: Following the fatal crash of UPS Airlines Flight 2976 on November 4, 2025, the FAA ordered inspections that have led to the grounding of McDonnell Douglas MD-11 freighters. By December 2025, these groundings had removed approximately 9% of the UPS fleet and 4% of the FedEx fleet from operation. The loss of 54 MD-11 planes during the peak December volume period caused express freight delays and forced some cargo onto passenger planes and ground transport.
properties.geocode_display_name: Nan, Houston, Harris County, Texas, 77092, United States

properties.title: Mexico Formalized Tariffs
properties.description: Mexico Formalized Tariffs: On December 29, 2025, Mexico's legislative reform to the General Import and Export Taxes Law was published, formalizing and making permanent the increased tariffs (ranging from 5% to 50%) on over 1,400 product categories, including automotive parts, textiles, steel, and plastics. These changes, effective January 1, 2026, primarily target non-FTA countries such as China, South Korea, and India, prompting concern and potential shifts in sourcing for companies serving the North American market.
properties.geocode_display_name: MEXICO, 216, Черноморская улица, Витязево, муниципальный округ Анапа, Краснодарский край, 353417, Россия

properties.title: EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM)

properties.description: Forklift Origin Falsification: The DOJ has also pursued charges against executives for importing Chinese-manufactured forklifts while concealing their origin to evade Section 301 tariffs.
